title: Horizon Bancorp (IN) Q1 2025 Earnings: EPS of $0. ...
text:
Horizon Bancorp (IN) (HBNC, Financial) released its 8-K filing on April 23, 2025, reporting robust financial results for the first quarter of 2025. The company, a U.S.-based holding entity providing comprehensive banking services, demonstrated significant growth in key financial metrics, surpassing analyst estimates for both earnings per share (EPS) and revenue.
Company Overview
Horizon Bancorp (IN) is a prominent provider of commercial and retail banking services, offering a wide range of financial products including commercial loans, real estate loans, and consumer credit facilities. The company operates primarily in the commercial banking sector, focusing on delivering value through its core banking services.
Performance Highlights and Strategic Moves
For the first quarter of 2025, Horizon Bancorp reported a net income of $23.9 million, or $0.54 per diluted share, significantly exceeding the analyst estimate of $0.43 per share. This marks a substantial improvement from a net loss of $10.9 million, or $0.25 per share, in the previous quarter, and a notable increase from $14.0 million, or $0.32 per share, in the same quarter last year.
The company's revenue also surpassed expectations, driven by a strategic focus on high-yielding loans and efficient expense management. Horizon Bancorp's net interest margin expanded for the sixth consecutive quarter, reaching 3.04%, up from 2.97% in the previous quarter and 2.50% a year ago. This expansion reflects a favorable shift in asset and funding mix, alongside disciplined pricing strategies.
Financial Achievements and Industry Implications
Horizon Bancorp's financial achievements are particularly noteworthy in the banking industry, where margin expansion and loan growth are critical indicators of financial health and operational efficiency. The company reported a 5% annualized increase in total loans held for investment, with a significant $103.3 million growth in commercial loans. This growth was partially offset by a strategic runoff of lower-yielding indirect auto loans.
Core deposits remained stable, with non-interest-bearing balances growing by $62.5 million, or 24% annualized. The company's credit quality also remained strong, with annualized net charge-offs at a low 0.07% of average loans, indicating effective risk management practices.
Income Statement and Balance Sheet Insights
Net interest income for the quarter was $52.3 million, slightly down from $53.1 million in the previous quarter, due to a decline in average interest-earning asset balances. However, the sale of the mortgage warehouse business contributed a pre-tax gain of $7.0 million, enhancing non-interest income to $16.5 million, a significant recovery from a $29.0 million loss in the previous quarter.
On the balance sheet, total assets decreased by $175.5 million to $7.6 billion, primarily due to the sale of the mortgage warehouse portfolio. Total deposits increased by $165.1 million to $5.8 billion, reflecting strong customer retention and growth in time deposits.
Key Metrics and Financial Ratios
Metric | Q1 2025 | Q4 2024 | Q1 2024 |
---|---|---|---|
Net Interest Margin | 3.04% | 2.97% | 2.50% |
Return on Average Assets | 1.25% | (0.55)% | 0.72% |
Return on Average Equity | 12.44% | (5.73)% | 7.76% |
Efficiency Ratio | 57.16% | 185.89% | 69.73% |
Analysis and Outlook
Horizon Bancorp's strong first-quarter performance underscores its strategic focus on core banking operations and efficient capital management. The company's ability to expand its net interest margin and grow its loan portfolio amidst an uncertain economic environment highlights its resilience and adaptability. The successful sale of the mortgage warehouse business not only improved non-interest income but also streamlined operations, positioning the company for sustained growth.
Overall, Horizon Bancorp's financial results reflect a well-executed strategy that aligns with industry trends, providing a solid foundation for future performance. Investors and stakeholders will likely view these results as a positive indicator of the company's financial health and strategic direction.

title: Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim files defamation case against YouTuber | Details inside
text: New Delhi: In a recent development, Gurmeet Ram Rahim, the head of Dera Sacha Sauda in Sirsa, Haryana, currently serving jail time, has filed a defamation case against a YouTuber named Shyam Meera Singh. In the petition filed on behalf of Ram Rahim in Delhi High Court, a demand was made to direct Shyam to remove the video uploaded on YouTube in which Ram Rahim is accused of deceiving his followers. The petition was heard in the court of Justice Shalinder Kaur. The court issued a notice on the matter. The court has scheduled the next hearing for Saturday. During the hearing, Ram Rahim’s lawyers argued that the video uploaded by Shyam Meera Singh was defamatory and insulting in nature. They further claimed that Singh is a “habitual criminal” with a registered case against him for insulting the Chief Minister of Uttar Pradesh. Additionally, Singh was reportedly terminated from Aaj Tak earlier for “insulting the Prime Minister.” However, Shyam Meera Singh or his lawyer were not present in the court during the hearing. According to information, a video was uploaded by Shyam Meera Singh on December 17, titled “How did Gurmeet Ram Rahim fool his devotees?” In response, a legal notice was sent to Singh on behalf of Ram Rahim. However, according to Ram Rahim’s lawyers, Singh refused the request to remove the video. Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh was sentenced to 20 years in prison in 2017 for the rape of two disciples. Additionally, he is serving a life sentence for his involvement in the 2002 killings of Dera Manager Ranjit Singh and Journalist Ram Chander Chhatrapati. Cold Start Dooms Purple Eagles in Loss to Canisius

How it Happened The Purple Eagles (1-17, 0-10 MAAC) fell behind early and could never fully recover, trailing by as many as 20 points in what became their 12th straight loss this season.
